intro: Gymnogramma alpina, commonly known as the Alpine Gymnogramma, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant has a creeping rhizome and produces fertile fronds with sporangia arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Gymnogramma alpina is well adapted to cool climates and is often seen in alpine and subalpine habitats.
